subject: Re: [junit] continues performance testing?
msgSnippet: Alexander, The Eclipse team has a fairly mature way of dealing with performance testing and requirements, in my opinion.  You can get a flavor of their
messageBody:
Alexander,

The Eclipse team has a fairly mature way of dealing with performance
testing and requirements, in my opinion. You can get a flavor of their
approach here:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/org.eclipse.test.performance/doc/Performance%20Tests%20HowTo.html

(They post the performance test results regularly, but I couldn't find
the page immediately. Sorry)

David Saff

Alexander Rupsch wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I'm looking for a framework to observe the performance development of
> our code. I have a set of performance tests and I want to measure the
> performance delta of two runs of the tests. If the the current run is
> significant slower than the last run[*], my observing test should fail
> telling me that there is something wrong.
>
> [*] last run is just one example, maybe sometimes it makes more sense to
> use the fastest previous run as comparator.
>
> Does someone know about such a tool? How do you handle such testing
> requirements?
>
>
> regards
>
> --
> Alexander Rupsch
> http://www.dreinhalb.de
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
